getDataTypeURN

public java.lang.String getDataTypeURN(java.lang.String name)
Retrieve the unique URN of a data-type (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name primary name (or synonym) of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt", "GO")
Returns:
unique (official) URN of the resource

getDataTypeURNs

public java.lang.String[] getDataTypeURNs(java.lang.String name)
Retrieve the unique (official) URN of the resource (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org") and all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name or synonym of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URN and all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeURL

public java.lang.String getDataTypeURL(java.lang.String name)
Retrieve unique (official) URL (not a physical URL but a URI) of the resource (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URL of the resource

getDataTypeURLs

public java.lang.String[] getDataTypeURLs(java.lang.String name)
Retrieve the unique (official) URL (not a physical URL but a URI) of the resource (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/") and all the deprecated ones.

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
Returns:
unique URL of the resource and all the deprecated ones

getDataTypeURI

public java.lang.String getDataTypeURI(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String type)
Retieve the unique (official) URL or URN of the resource (example: "http://www.taxonomy.org/", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name of the data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL')
Returns:
unique URL or URN of the resource

getURN

public java.lang.String getURN(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String id)
Retieve the unique URN of the resource (example: "urn:lsid:uniprot.org:P62158").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
unique URN of the resource

getURL

public java.lang.String getURL(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String id)
Retrieve unique URN of the resource (example: "http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
unique URN of the resource

getURI

public java.lang.String getURI(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String id,
                               java.lang.String type)
Retrieve the unique URI (URL or URN) of the resource (example: "http://www.geneontology.org/#GO:0045202", "urn:lsid:uniprot.org").

Parameters:
name - name of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
type - type of the URI the user wants to recover ('URN' or 'URL')
Returns:
unique URI of the resource

Returns:
definition of the data-type

getDataEntries

public java.lang.String[] getDataEntries(java.lang.String nickname,
                                         java.lang.String id)
Retrieve the physical locationS (URLs) of web pageS about the element.

Parameters:
nickname - name (can be a synonym) or URN or URL of a data-type (examples: "ChEBI", "UniProt")
id - identifier of an element (examples: "GO:0045202", "P62158")
Returns:
physical locationS of web pageS about the element

getDataResources

public java.lang.String[] getDataResources(java.lang.String nickname)
Retrieve all the physical locations (URLs) of the services providing the resource (web page).

Parameters:
nickname - name (can be a synonym) or URL or URN of a data-type name (or synonym) or URI (URL or URN)
Returns:
array of strings containing all the physical locations

isDeprecated

public java.lang.String isDeprecated(java.lang.String uri)
To know if a URI is deprecated.

Parameters:
uri - (URN or URL) of a data-type
Returns:
answer ("true" or "false") to the question: is this URI deprecated?

getOfficialURI

public java.lang.String getOfficialURI(java.lang.String uri)
Retrieve the offical URI (URN if the user entered a URN, URL if not) corresponding to the deprecated one.

Parameters:
uri - deprecated URI (URN or URL) of a data-type
Returns:
the offical URI corresponding to the deprecated one

getDataTypePattern

public java.lang.String getDataTypePattern(java.lang.String nickname)
Retrieve the pattern (regular expression) of the data-type

Parameters:
nickname - data-type name (or synonym) or URI (URL or URN)
Returns:
pattern of the data-type

getDataTypeSynonyms

Parameters:
name - or synonym of a data-type
Returns:

Parameters:

Returns:
